Field Detail

cron

public static Scheduler cron
cron4j cron object.

priority

public static java.lang.Integer priority
Thread priority for cron, valid range is likely from 1-10, but the current envirenment is tested to determine the actual valid range. Default value is 9. Other threads in this plug-in run at level 6. A lower level can cause a delay in the execution of the script. In my tests on Windows Vista, a level of 6 caused up to 10 min. delay, and level 9 had very little/no delay.

tasks

public static java.util.Map tasks
Holds map of Name:ScriptCronTask object.

Method Detail

add

static java.lang.String add(java.lang.Object fmpro, java.lang.Object script, java.lang.Object parameter, java.lang.Object schedule, java.lang.Object options)
Add/modify a task in the cron scheduler.
Parameters:
fmpro - object from ScriptMaster
script - name to run
parameter - to send to script
schedule - (UNIX crontab-like pattern)
options - file name of file to perform script in (defaults to current file) name name of schedule (defaults to file name::script) if the name already exists, it will be replaced priority priority for this task. same as this.priority, except it only applies to this task. autostart (default=true) if true, will automatically start the cron scheduler after adding this task
Returns:
name of task created

delete

static java.lang.Boolean delete(java.lang.Object name)
Delete a scheduled tasks by name. If no more schedules exist, stop cron.
Returns:
true if completed without error

deleteAll

static java.lang.Boolean deleteAll()
Delete all scheduled tasks, then stop cron.
Returns:
true if completed without error

list

static java.lang.String list()
Returns:
list of all scheduled tasks

next

static java.lang.String next(java.lang.Object qty)
Determine the trigger times for all current schedules.
Parameters:
name - of task to test
qty - of values to return
Returns:
list of TimeStamps

prioritySet

static java.lang.Boolean prioritySet(java.lang.Object value)
Set the priority property and the cron priority if the cron is started.
Parameters:

run

static java.lang.Object run(java.lang.String methodName, Object[] args = null)

start

static java.lang.Boolean start()
Start cron if it is not already started, then set it's priority from the value of the priority property.
Returns:
true if completed without error

stop

static java.lang.Boolean stop()
Stop cron, which prevents all scheduled tasks from running. The tasks are not deleted, only paused. If a task is defined to run while cron is stopped, that task will be skipped; it will NOT run when the cron is started (not until it's testSchedule schedule, that is).
Returns:
true if completed without error

taskExists

static java.lang.Boolean taskExists(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Boolean required = false)
Test if a task name exists in both the tasks property and in cron scheduler. If task exists in tasks property, but not cron scheduler, throw Exception. Optionally throw Exception if task does not exist in tasks property.
Parameters:
name - of task
required - , if true will throw Exception if task does not exist (default is false)
Returns:
true if task exists, otherwise false

testSchedule

static java.lang.String testSchedule(java.lang.Object schedule, java.lang.Object qty)
Determine the trigger times for a schedule pattern.
Parameters:
schedule - (UNIX crontab-like pattern)
qty - of values to return
Returns:
list of TimeStamps

validatePriority

static java.lang.Integer validatePriority(java.lang.Object value, java.lang.Boolean allowNull = false)
Throw exception if value cannot be converted to an Integer, or is not in the valid range. The valid range is determined by the current threads valid priority range.
Parameters:
value
allowNull - if true, will not throw Exception if value is null
Returns:
value as Integer

validateSchedule

static void validateSchedule(java.lang.Object pattern)
Throw exception if pattern is invalid.
Parameters:
pattern - for a schedule
